Description: Upper body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; reserved handle zone with part of handle palmette and inscription to its right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd is also published in D. Piekarski, "Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akad. Mus. Bonn" in U.Hoekmann and D.Kreikenbom, Naukratis. Die Beziehungen zu Ostgriechenland, Aegypten und Zypern in archaischer Zeit, Acts of Round Table in Mainz (25-27 November 1999), Bibliopolis 2001, p.104 pl.13, no. 4 Piekarski suggests that the inscription on the sherd might refer to the painter Archikles whose signature has been found on other vases alongside the potter Glaukytes. For other examples, see ABV, p. 160, no. 2 in Munich.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 38, no. C.3, pl. 11, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1381) (phase 3)
